panels.title: Bot Score Source Engine

targets.expr: sum by (BotScoreSrc) (count_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="http_requests"} | json BotScoreSrc, ClientASN, ClientCountry, ClientIP, ClientRequestHost, ClientRequestPath, EdgeColoCode, JA4, ZoneName | ZoneName =~ "$zone" | ClientRequestHost =~ "$host" | ClientCountry =~ "$country" | ClientRequestPath =~ "$path" | ClientIP =~ "$ip" | JA4 =~ "$ja4" | ClientASN =~ "$asn" | EdgeColoCode =~ "$colo" | BotScoreSrc != `` | BotScoreSrc != `Not Computed` [$__auto]))

panels.description: Which detection engine computed the bot score: Machine Learning, Heuristics, JS Fingerprinting, or Behavioral Analysis.

panels.title: Verified Bot Categories

targets.expr: sum by (VerifiedBotCategory) (count_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="http_requests"} | json ClientASN, ClientCountry, ClientIP, ClientRequestHost, ClientRequestPath, EdgeColoCode, JA4, VerifiedBotCategory, ZoneName | ZoneName =~ "$zone" | ClientRequestHost =~ "$host" | ClientCountry =~ "$country" | ClientRequestPath =~ "$path" | ClientIP =~ "$ip" | JA4 =~ "$ja4" | ClientASN =~ "$asn" | EdgeColoCode =~ "$colo" | VerifiedBotCategory != `` [$__auto]))

panels.description: Known legitimate bots verified by Cloudflare (Googlebot, Bingbot, etc.) grouped by category.

panels.title: JS Detection Pass/Fail

targets.expr: sum by (JSDetectionPassed) (count_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="http_requests"} | json ClientASN, ClientCountry, ClientIP, ClientRequestHost, ClientRequestPath, EdgeColoCode, JA4, JSDetectionPassed, ZoneName | ZoneName =~ "$zone" | ClientRequestHost =~ "$host" | ClientCountry =~ "$country" | ClientRequestPath =~ "$path" | ClientIP =~ "$ip" | JA4 =~ "$ja4" | ClientASN =~ "$asn" | EdgeColoCode =~ "$colo" | JSDetectionPassed != `` [$__auto]))

panels.description: JavaScript fingerprinting challenge results. 'failed' = client did not execute JS (likely headless bot). 'missing' = challenge not served.

panels.title: Bot Traffic by Path (score < 30)

targets.expr: approx_topk(25, sum by (ClientRequestPath) (count_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="http_requests"} | json BotScore, ClientASN, ClientCountry, ClientIP, ClientRequestHost, ClientRequestPath, EdgeColoCode, JA4, ZoneName | ZoneName =~ "$zone" | ClientRequestHost =~ "$host" | ClientCountry =~ "$country" | ClientRequestPath =~ "$path" | ClientIP =~ "$ip" | JA4 =~ "$ja4" | ClientASN =~ "$asn" | EdgeColoCode =~ "$colo" | BotScore > 0 | BotScore < 30 [$__range])))

panels.description: Paths targeted by likely-bot traffic (BotScore 1-29). Shows which endpoints bots are hitting most. Cross-reference with Detection IDs and Fingerprints panels for the full picture.

panels.title: Bot Traffic by IP (score < 30)

targets.expr: approx_topk(25, sum by (ClientIP) (count_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="http_requests"} | json BotScore, ClientASN, ClientCountry, ClientIP, ClientRequestHost, ClientRequestPath, EdgeColoCode, JA4, ZoneName | ZoneName =~ "$zone" | ClientRequestHost =~ "$host" | ClientCountry =~ "$country" | ClientRequestPath =~ "$path" | ClientIP =~ "$ip" | JA4 =~ "$ja4" | ClientASN =~ "$asn" | EdgeColoCode =~ "$colo" | BotScore > 0 | BotScore < 30 [$__range])))

panels.description: IPs sending the most bot traffic (BotScore 1-29). Use the IP filter variable to drill into a specific IP's paths, user agents, and detection IDs.

panels.title: Bot Detection IDs

targets.expr: approx_topk(25, sum by (BotDetectionIDs) (count_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="http_requests"} | json BotDetectionIDs, ClientASN, ClientCountry, ClientIP, ClientRequestHost, ClientRequestPath, EdgeColoCode, JA4, ZoneName | ZoneName =~ "$zone" | ClientRequestHost =~ "$host" | ClientCountry =~ "$country" | ClientRequestPath =~ "$path" | ClientIP =~ "$ip" | JA4 =~ "$ja4" | ClientASN =~ "$asn" | EdgeColoCode =~ "$colo" | BotDetectionIDs != `` | BotDetectionIDs != `[]` [$__range])))

panels.description: Which bot detection types are firing most. Account Takeover (201326xxx), Scraping (50331648/49), Residential Proxy (50331651), AI Crawlers, Heuristic. Use these IDs in cf.bot_management.detection_ids WAF rules.

panels.title: Bot Fingerprints by JA4 (score < 30)

targets.expr: approx_topk(25, sum by (JA4) (count_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="http_requests"} | json BotScore, ClientASN, ClientCountry, ClientIP, ClientRequestHost, ClientRequestPath, EdgeColoCode, JA4, ZoneName | ZoneName =~ "$zone" | ClientRequestHost =~ "$host" | ClientCountry =~ "$country" | ClientRequestPath =~ "$path" | ClientIP =~ "$ip" | JA4 =~ "$ja4" | ClientASN =~ "$asn" | EdgeColoCode =~ "$colo" | JA4 != `` | BotScore > 0 | BotScore < 30 [$__range])))

panels.description: TLS fingerprints of bot traffic. Same JA4 = same TLS stack regardless of IP rotation. Use JA4 as a rate limiting characteristic in WAF rules to catch distributed bots.

panels.title: Requests/sec by IP (Top 10)

targets.expr: topk(10, sum by (ClientIP) (rate({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="http_requests"} | json ClientASN, ClientCountry, ClientIP, ClientRequestHost, ClientRequestPath, EdgeColoCode, JA4, ZoneName | ZoneName =~ "$zone" | ClientRequestHost =~ "$host" | ClientCountry =~ "$country" | ClientRequestPath =~ "$path" | ClientIP =~ "$ip" | JA4 =~ "$ja4" | ClientASN =~ "$asn" | EdgeColoCode =~ "$colo" [$__auto])))

panels.description: Per-IP request rate (requests/second). Identifies IPs sending traffic at high velocity. Cloudflare rate limiting counters track per-IP rates — this shows what those counters see.

panels.title: Requests by Path (Top 10)

targets.expr: topk(10, sum by (ClientRequestPath) (count_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="http_requests"} | json ClientASN, ClientCountry, ClientIP, ClientRequestHost, ClientRequestPath, EdgeColoCode, JA4, ZoneName | ZoneName =~ "$zone" | ClientRequestHost =~ "$host" | ClientCountry =~ "$country" | ClientRequestPath =~ "$path" | ClientIP =~ "$ip" | JA4 =~ "$ja4" | ClientASN =~ "$asn" | EdgeColoCode =~ "$colo" [$__auto])))

panels.description: Per-path request count per interval. Identifies endpoints receiving the most traffic. Uses count_over_time instead of rate() to reduce cardinality pressure on high-cardinality path labels.

panels.title: Requests/sec by ASN (Top 10)

targets.expr: topk(10, sum by (ClientASN) (rate({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="http_requests"} | json ClientASN, ClientCountry, ClientIP, ClientRequestHost, ClientRequestPath, EdgeColoCode, JA4, ZoneName | ZoneName =~ "$zone" | ClientRequestHost =~ "$host" | ClientCountry =~ "$country" | ClientRequestPath =~ "$path" | ClientIP =~ "$ip" | JA4 =~ "$ja4" | ClientASN =~ "$asn" | EdgeColoCode =~ "$colo" [$__auto])))

panels.description: Per-ASN request rate. Identifies networks sending traffic at high velocity. ASN is a common rate limiting characteristic for mitigating distributed attacks from a single network.

panels.title: Requests/sec by Edge Colo (Top 10)

targets.expr: topk(10, sum by (EdgeColoCode) (rate({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="http_requests"} | json ClientASN, ClientCountry, ClientIP, ClientRequestHost, ClientRequestPath, EdgeColoCode, JA4, ZoneName | ZoneName =~ "$zone" | ClientRequestHost =~ "$host" | ClientCountry =~ "$country" | ClientRequestPath =~ "$path" | ClientIP =~ "$ip" | JA4 =~ "$ja4" | ClientASN =~ "$asn" | EdgeColoCode =~ "$colo" [$__auto])))

panels.description: Per-datacenter request rate. Cloudflare rate limiting counters are per-colo (not global). A rate limit of 100 req/10s means 100 per colo, so total allowed traffic = rate × number of active colos.

panels.title: Top IPs by Request Volume

targets.expr: approx_topk(25, sum by (ClientIP) (count_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="http_requests"} | json ClientASN, ClientCountry, ClientIP, ClientRequestHost, ClientRequestPath, EdgeColoCode, JA4, ZoneName | ZoneName =~ "$zone" | ClientRequestHost =~ "$host" | ClientCountry =~ "$country" | ClientRequestPath =~ "$path" | ClientIP =~ "$ip" | JA4 =~ "$ja4" | ClientASN =~ "$asn" | EdgeColoCode =~ "$colo" [$__range])))

panels.description: IPs with the highest total request count during the time range. These are the strongest candidates for rate limiting rules.

panels.title: Top Paths by Request Volume

targets.expr: approx_topk(25, sum by (ClientRequestPath) (count_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="http_requests"} | json ClientASN, ClientCountry, ClientIP, ClientRequestHost, ClientRequestPath, EdgeColoCode, JA4, ZoneName | ZoneName =~ "$zone" | ClientRequestHost =~ "$host" | ClientCountry =~ "$country" | ClientRequestPath =~ "$path" | ClientIP =~ "$ip" | JA4 =~ "$ja4" | ClientASN =~ "$asn" | EdgeColoCode =~ "$colo" [$__range])))

panels.description: Paths with the most requests. Use to set per-endpoint rate limiting thresholds — a login endpoint should have a much lower threshold than a static asset path.

panels.title: Top JA4 by Request Volume

targets.expr: approx_topk(25, sum by (JA4) (count_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="http_requests"} | json ClientASN, ClientCountry, ClientIP, ClientRequestHost, ClientRequestPath, EdgeColoCode, JA4, ZoneName | ZoneName =~ "$zone" | ClientRequestHost =~ "$host" | ClientCountry =~ "$country" | ClientRequestPath =~ "$path" | ClientIP =~ "$ip" | JA4 =~ "$ja4" | ClientASN =~ "$asn" | EdgeColoCode =~ "$colo" | JA4 != `` [$__range])))

panels.description: TLS fingerprints with the most requests. JA4 is a rate limiting characteristic — same TLS stack = same fingerprint regardless of IP rotation.

panels.title: Request Rate Analysis
panels.description: Request velocity and burst detection. Mirrors Cloudflare's rate limiting request rate model — per-IP, per-path, per-ASN, and per-colo request rates. Use these panels to identify traffic patterns that rate limiting rules are designed to catch.

panels.title: Client Request Bytes (avg)

targets.expr: sum(avg_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="http_requests"} | json ClientASN, ClientCountry, ClientIP, ClientRequestBytes, ClientRequestHost, ClientRequestPath, EdgeColoCode, JA4, ZoneName | ZoneName =~ "$zone" | ClientRequestHost =~ "$host" | ClientCountry =~ "$country" | ClientRequestPath =~ "$path" | ClientIP =~ "$ip" | JA4 =~ "$ja4" | ClientASN =~ "$asn" | EdgeColoCode =~ "$colo" | unwrap ClientRequestBytes [$__auto]))

sum(quantile_over_time(0.95, {job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="http_requests"} | json ClientASN, ClientCountry, ClientIP, ClientRequestBytes, ClientRequestHost, ClientRequestPath, EdgeColoCode, JA4, ZoneName | ZoneName =~ "$zone" | ClientRequestHost =~ "$host" | ClientCountry =~ "$country" | ClientRequestPath =~ "$path" | ClientIP =~ "$ip" | JA4 =~ "$ja4" | ClientASN =~ "$asn" | EdgeColoCode =~ "$colo" | unwrap ClientRequestBytes [$__auto]))

panels.description: Average and p95 client request body size in bytes. Large requests may indicate file uploads, API payloads, or abuse.

panels.title: Edge Response Body Bytes (avg)

targets.expr: sum(avg_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="http_requests"} | json ClientASN, ClientCountry, ClientIP, ClientRequestHost, ClientRequestPath, EdgeColoCode, EdgeResponseBodyBytes, JA4, ZoneName | ZoneName =~ "$zone" | ClientRequestHost =~ "$host" | ClientCountry =~ "$country" | ClientRequestPath =~ "$path" | ClientIP =~ "$ip" | JA4 =~ "$ja4" | ClientASN =~ "$asn" | EdgeColoCode =~ "$colo" | unwrap EdgeResponseBodyBytes [$__auto]))

sum(quantile_over_time(0.95, {job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="http_requests"} | json ClientASN, ClientCountry, ClientIP, ClientRequestHost, ClientRequestPath, EdgeColoCode, EdgeResponseBodyBytes, JA4, ZoneName | ZoneName =~ "$zone" | ClientRequestHost =~ "$host" | ClientCountry =~ "$country" | ClientRequestPath =~ "$path" | ClientIP =~ "$ip" | JA4 =~ "$ja4" | ClientASN =~ "$asn" | EdgeColoCode =~ "$colo" | unwrap EdgeResponseBodyBytes [$__auto]))

panels.description: Average and p95 edge response body size. Excludes headers. Large responses may indicate unoptimized images, large API payloads, or data exfiltration.

panels.title: Largest Uploads by Path (avg request bytes)

targets.expr: topk(20, avg by (ClientRequestPath) (avg_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="http_requests"} | json ClientASN, ClientCountry, ClientIP, ClientRequestBytes, ClientRequestHost, ClientRequestPath, EdgeColoCode, JA4, ZoneName | ZoneName =~ "$zone" | ClientRequestHost =~ "$host" | ClientCountry =~ "$country" | ClientRequestPath =~ "$path" | ClientIP =~ "$ip" | JA4 =~ "$ja4" | ClientASN =~ "$asn" | EdgeColoCode =~ "$colo" | ClientRequestBytes > 10000 | unwrap ClientRequestBytes [$__range])))

panels.description: Paths receiving the largest request payloads (>10KB average). Identifies file upload endpoints and potential abuse vectors.

panels.title: Largest Responses by Path (avg response bytes)

targets.expr: topk(20, avg by (ClientRequestPath) (avg_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="http_requests"} | json ClientASN, ClientCountry, ClientIP, ClientRequestHost, ClientRequestPath, EdgeColoCode, EdgeResponseBodyBytes, JA4, ZoneName | ZoneName =~ "$zone" | ClientRequestHost =~ "$host" | ClientCountry =~ "$country" | ClientRequestPath =~ "$path" | ClientIP =~ "$ip" | JA4 =~ "$ja4" | ClientASN =~ "$asn" | EdgeColoCode =~ "$colo" | EdgeResponseBodyBytes > 100000 | unwrap EdgeResponseBodyBytes [$__range])))

panels.description: Paths serving the largest responses (>100KB average). Candidates for compression, CDN caching, or image optimization.

panels.title: Requests by Host

targets.expr: sum by (ClientRequestHost) (count_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="http_requests"} | json ClientASN, ClientCountry, ClientIP, ClientRequestHost, ClientRequestPath, EdgeColoCode, JA4, ZoneName | ZoneName =~ "$zone" | ClientRequestHost =~ "$host" | ClientCountry =~ "$country" | ClientRequestPath =~ "$path" | ClientIP =~ "$ip" | JA4 =~ "$ja4" | ClientASN =~ "$asn" | EdgeColoCode =~ "$colo" [$__auto]))

panels.description: Request volume per host. Shows traffic distribution across your zones/subdomains.

panels.title: Bandwidth by Host — CF → Eyeball (charged)

targets.expr: sum by (ClientRequestHost) (sum_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="http_requests"} | json ClientASN, ClientCountry, ClientIP, ClientRequestHost, ClientRequestPath, EdgeColoCode, EdgeResponseBytes, JA4, ZoneName | ZoneName =~ "$zone" | ClientRequestHost =~ "$host" | ClientCountry =~ "$country" | ClientRequestPath =~ "$path" | ClientIP =~ "$ip" | JA4 =~ "$ja4" | ClientASN =~ "$asn" | EdgeColoCode =~ "$colo" | unwrap EdgeResponseBytes [$__auto]))

panels.description: Total bytes Cloudflare sends to visitors (EdgeResponseBytes) per host. This is what Cloudflare bills on — includes headers + body. The primary metric for bandwidth cost analysis.

panels.title: Bandwidth by Host — Origin → CF (informational)

targets.expr: sum by (ClientRequestHost) (sum_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="http_requests"} | json CacheCacheStatus, ClientASN, ClientCountry, ClientIP, ClientRequestHost, ClientRequestPath, EdgeColoCode, EdgeResponseBytes, JA4, ZoneName | ZoneName =~ "$zone" | ClientRequestHost =~ "$host" | ClientCountry =~ "$country" | ClientRequestPath =~ "$path" | ClientIP =~ "$ip" | JA4 =~ "$ja4" | ClientASN =~ "$asn" | EdgeColoCode =~ "$colo" | CacheCacheStatus != `` | CacheCacheStatus != `hit` | CacheCacheStatus != `stale` | CacheCacheStatus != `revalidated` | unwrap EdgeResponseBytes [$__auto]))

panels.description: Bytes pulled from origin to Cloudflare per host (cache misses only). Not charged by Cloudflare, but may incur egress costs from your origin provider (AWS, GCP, etc). Filtered to CacheCacheStatus != hit/stale/revalidated.

panels.title: CF → Eyeball vs Origin → CF (total)

targets.expr: sum(sum_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="http_requests"} | json ClientASN, ClientCountry, ClientIP, ClientRequestHost, ClientRequestPath, EdgeColoCode, EdgeResponseBytes, JA4, ZoneName | ZoneName =~ "$zone" | ClientRequestHost =~ "$host" | ClientCountry =~ "$country" | ClientRequestPath =~ "$path" | ClientIP =~ "$ip" | JA4 =~ "$ja4" | ClientASN =~ "$asn" | EdgeColoCode =~ "$colo" | unwrap EdgeResponseBytes [$__auto]))

sum(sum_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="http_requests"} | json CacheCacheStatus, ClientASN, ClientCountry, ClientIP, ClientRequestHost, ClientRequestPath, EdgeColoCode, EdgeResponseBytes, JA4, ZoneName | ZoneName =~ "$zone" | ClientRequestHost =~ "$host" | ClientCountry =~ "$country" | ClientRequestPath =~ "$path" | ClientIP =~ "$ip" | JA4 =~ "$ja4" | ClientASN =~ "$asn" | EdgeColoCode =~ "$colo" | CacheCacheStatus != `` | CacheCacheStatus != `hit` | CacheCacheStatus != `stale` | CacheCacheStatus != `revalidated` | unwrap EdgeResponseBytes [$__auto]))

panels.description: Comparison of total bandwidth: CF→Eyeball (EdgeResponseBytes, what Cloudflare charges) vs Origin→CF (cache misses only, what your origin provider may charge for egress). The gap between the lines is bandwidth saved by caching.

panels.title: Request & Response Size
panels.description: Request and response payload size analysis. Identifies large uploads, oversized responses, and bandwidth consumption patterns.

panels.title: Worker Outcomes

targets.expr: sum by (Outcome) (count_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="workers_trace_events"} | json Outcome [$__auto]))

panels.description: Worker execution outcomes. 'exception' = unhandled error, 'exceeded_cpu' = hit CPU time limit, 'exceeded_memory' = hit memory limit.

panels.title: Worker CPU Time (ms)

targets.expr: avg by (ScriptName) (avg_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="workers_trace_events"} | json CPUTimeMs, ScriptName | unwrap CPUTimeMs [$__auto]))
sum(quantile_over_time(0.95, {job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="workers_trace_events"} | json CPUTimeMs | unwrap CPUTimeMs [$__auto]))

panels.description: CPU time consumed per Worker invocation. Workers have a 10ms (free) or 50ms (paid) CPU time limit. Approaching the limit risks 'exceeded_cpu' outcomes.

panels.title: Worker Wall Time (ms)

targets.expr: avg by (ScriptName) (avg_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="workers_trace_events"} | json ScriptName, WallTimeMs | unwrap WallTimeMs [$__auto]))
sum(quantile_over_time(0.95, {job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="workers_trace_events"} | json WallTimeMs | unwrap WallTimeMs [$__auto]))

panels.description: Total wall-clock time per Worker invocation (includes I/O wait). Wall time limit is 30s (default). Unlike CPU time, I/O wait does not count toward CPU limits.

panels.title: Worker Invocations by Script

targets.expr: sum by (ScriptName) (count_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="workers_trace_events"} | json ScriptName [$__auto]))

panels.description: Number of Worker invocations per script over time.

panels.title: Worker Script Versions

targets.expr: sum by (ScriptName, ScriptVersion) (count_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="workers_trace_events"} | json ScriptName, ScriptVersion | ScriptVersion != `` [$__auto]))

panels.description: Worker script version tracking. Useful during deployments to confirm new versions are receiving traffic.

panels.title: Worker Subrequest Count (avg)

targets.expr: avg by (WorkerScriptName) (avg_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="http_requests"} | json ClientASN, ClientCountry, ClientIP, ClientRequestHost, ClientRequestPath, EdgeColoCode, JA4, WorkerScriptName, WorkerSubrequestCount, ZoneName | ZoneName =~ "$zone" | ClientRequestHost =~ "$host" | ClientCountry =~ "$country" | ClientRequestPath =~ "$path" | ClientIP =~ "$ip" | JA4 =~ "$ja4" | ClientASN =~ "$asn" | EdgeColoCode =~ "$colo" | unwrap WorkerSubrequestCount [$__auto]))

panels.description: Average number of subrequests (fetch calls) per Worker invocation. Workers have a 50 subrequest limit per invocation.

panels.title: Worker Event Types

targets.expr: sum by (EventType) (count_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="workers_trace_events"} | json EventType [$__auto]))

panels.description: Worker event types: 'fetch' (HTTP request), 'cron' (scheduled trigger), 'alarm' (Durable Object alarm), 'queue' (Queue consumer). Shows the mix of invocation triggers.

panels.title: Worker Exceptions

targets.expr: topk(20, sum by (ScriptName, Exceptions) (count_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="workers_trace_events"} | json Exceptions, ScriptName | Exceptions != `` | Exceptions != `[]` [$__range])))

panels.description: Worker exceptions grouped by script and error message. Exceptions are unhandled errors thrown during execution.

panels.title: Worker Status by Script

targets.expr: sum by (ScriptName, Status) (count_over_time({job="cloudflare-logpush", dataset="workers_trace_events"} | json ScriptName, Status [$__auto]))

panels.description: Worker invocation status (ok/error) by script name. Shows the success/failure ratio per Worker.

list.description: Filter by Cloudflare zone name (domain). Filters HTTP requests by ZoneName field, and firewall events by ClientRequestHost (regex match). Use to isolate traffic for a specific zone.
list.label: Zone
list.name: zone

list.description: Filter by hostname (FQDN). More specific than zone — use for subdomains like blog.example.com within a zone.
list.label: Host
list.name: host

list.description: Filter by request path (regex, e.g. /api/.* or /login). Use .* for all.
list.label: Path
list.name: path

list.description: Filter by client IP (regex, e.g. 192\.168\.1\..* for prefix or exact IP). Use .* for all.
list.label: IP
list.name: ip

list.description: Filter by client country (multi-select). Matches on ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 code.
list.label: Country
list.name: country

options.text: Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha (SH)
South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands (GS)
United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland (GB)

list.description: Filter by JA4 TLS fingerprint (regex). Use .* for all.
list.label: JA4
list.name: ja4

list.description: Filter by client ASN number (regex, e.g. 13335 for Cloudflare). Use .* for all.
list.label: ASN
list.name: asn

list.description: Filter by edge colo code (regex, e.g. SIN|NRT|LAX). Use .* for all.
list.label: Colo
list.name: colo

title: Cloudflare Logpush
